sentence.Network_en: Shuck wicker skin, connect body to show white, call white wicker.
sentence.Network_cn: 把柳条剥去皮, 通体呈白色, 就叫白柳条.

sentence.Network_en: You must shuck off the bad habits of the past.
sentence.Network_cn: 你们必须去掉过去的不良习惯.

entry.def: The shuck of something is its outer covering, for example the leaves round an ear of corn, or the shell of a shellfish.
If you shuck something such as corn or shellfish, you remove it from its outer covering.

example.ex: On a good day, each employee will shuck 3,500 oysters.
example.tran: 天气晴好的时候，每位雇员一天能剥 3,500 只牡蛎。

entry.def: If you shuck something that you are wearing, you take it off.

example.ex: He shucked his coat and set to work.
example.tran: 他脱掉了外套开始工作。

entry.tran: (表示尴尬、失望或厌烦)哎，呸,什么，哪有的事
entry.def: Shucks is an exclamation that is used to express embarrassment, disappointment, or annoyance.

example.ex: Terry actually says 'Oh, shucks!' when complimented on her singing.
example.tran: 人们赞誉她的歌声时，特里实际上会说“噢，没什么!”

means.word_mean: 1. material consisting of seed coverings and small pieces of stem or leaves that have been separated from the seeds
